info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 28 at 11:58AM MDT until September 28 at 3:00PM MDT by NWS Albuquerque NM
info.description:
* WHAT...Arroyo and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected.
* WHERE...A portion of southeast New Mexico, including the following county, central Chaves.
* WHEN...Until 300 PM MDT.
* IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways.
* ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1152 AM MDT, public reported water over NM 13 at Old Y O Crossing Road west of US 285 in the advisory area due to showers and thunderstorms. In addition, scattered showers and isolated storms will create localized flooding of poorly drained areas near Dexter, Hagerman and Lake Arthur. This will cause arroyo and small stream flooding. Between 0.5 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.5 inches are expected over the area. This additional rain will result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Dexter, Hagerman, Lake Arthur, Greenfield and Roswell Correctional Facility. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction:
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.

parameter.value: FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON
